divs: sighting detailsit's the second time i submit this report, the first time the interface ate my text, and i was too angry to type it again. btw mufon people, please use a better interface, thanks. i work on an airport, my office has a large window looking toward the runway and the wood area behind it. on october 3, i was talking with a friend and looking in the direction of the window. i suddenly noticed a bright sunlight that was reflected on a shiny surface, it was something that was flying\gliding above ground. i first attributed it to an helicopter or a small aircraft in the aerodrome circuit, but when watching closely i noticed it was none of these. the object glided behind a patch of trees on a hill. i waited to see if it was reappearing on the other side of the hill but it never reappeared. the total observation time was approx. 5 seconds. the object was spherical, exactly like the cockpit on a small helicopter (like a bell 47 for example) but there was no "body" behind it and no rotor either, only the sphere. the sun was reflected on it like it would be on a car windshield or a cockpit (it was a very bright day, and it is a carribean island). the size and appearance were very much like a helicopter cockpit (i'd say 1.5 meters in diameter) it was flying above the ground, approx. 10 meters above and at the level of the trees. it was going very fast, i would estimate the speed to about 100 kilometers per hour or faster, faster than a small aircraft taking off or landing, but there was a strange quality to the flight, it seemed like it was almost gliding , it looked also as if it was slightly bouncing on the air, like a rock ricocheting on the surface of water. i could see no details or colors on the object because of the bright reflection. the appearance was like a cockpit or maybe a big weather balloon. i don't think that it was a weather balloon because it was going very fast and it was going in the exact opposite direction of the wind. it was moving parallel to the runway but behind it, outside of the airport. if i had to extrapolate its movement backwards, it's almost as it was coming from the sea inland (the airport is close to the sea). helis generally don't fly in that area and altitude, and it was not a plane (or it would have crashed). i also rule out any object moved by the wind (like a balloon or a kite) because of speed and movement against wind. at the distance it was and behind the heavy soundproof window, there was no possibility for me to listen to a possible noise. i was alone to make this observation. i work on airports, it's the second time i report something unusual on this website. for the other report, search the database for an event in france in 1993.
